content: gauge really doesn t matter on this project tribbles come in all sizes if you crochet looser you ll have a bigger tribble if you crochet tighter you ll have a larger tribble either way it s a tribble and it will love you about yarns you can use any eyelash or fuzzy yarn you want my first tribble used two strands of yarn bee wild child and the result was a blended tonal look one strand was a solid the other was two toned my test tribble for this pattern the red and brown one used two different yarns lion brand fun fur and wild child the fun fur is longer so it really took over the brown yarn recedes producing an undercoat i just finished a tribble that uses two strands of fun fur and it was a nightmare the longer unruly eyelashes tend to tangle horribly but it s still cute as can be if you want to try all sorts of weird novelty yarn combinations go for it i would love to see the results
